text: The 1978 North Texas State Mean Green football team represented North Texas State University—now known as the University of North Texas—during the 1978 NCAA Division I-A football season. In its sixth and final season under head coach Hayden Fry, the team compiled a 9–2 record. The team played its home games at Fouts Field in Denton, Texas. ==Schedule== ==Roster== ==Game summaries== ===Mississippi State=== {| class="wikitable" |- align="center" |- align="center" | 2–5 | 1977 | W 15–17 (MSU forfeit) |} ===Oklahoma State=== {| class="wikitable" |- align="center" |- align="center" | 0–4 | 1976 | L 10–16 |} ===at Texas=== {| class="wikitable" |- align="center" |- align="center" | 0–1 | 1976 | L 14–17 |} ==Team players in the 1979 NFL Draft== {|class="wikitable" width="80%" |- align="center" style="" | Player || Position || Round || Pick || NFL Club |- align="center" bgcolor="" | Reginald Lewis || DE || 3 || 78 || Tampa Bay Buccaneers |- align="center" bgcolor="" |} ==References== North Texas State Category:North Texas Mean Green football seasons North Texas State Football
